metadata.title: CVE-2019-20425 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has anout-of-bounds access and panic due to the lack of validation for specificfields of packets sent by a client. In the function lustre_msg_string,there is no validation of a certain length value derived fromlustre_msg_buflen_v2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-raspi package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-ibm package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
